title: Software Engineer
skills: Understading the OOPs concept and Design Pattern
Familier with version conrol (like Git,Git Hub/Git Lab)
Knowledge of software development methodologies (like Agile,Scrum)
Ability to use IDEs ans developement tools efficiently
description: Software Engineers design, develop, and maintain software systems.
about: As a Software Engineer at Google, you'll design, develop, test, and deploy software solutions that impact billions of users worldwide. You'll work on cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, designers, and other engineers, and contribute to large-scale distributed systems. The role requires strong problem-solving skills, proficiency in data structures and algorithms, and the ability to write clean, maintainable code. You'll participate in code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and continuously learn new technologies to stay ahead in the fast-paced tech landscape.
responsibilites: Design and implement scalable software solutions using modern programming languages
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers
Debug and troubleshoot complex issues in production systems
Collaborate with product managers and designers to understand requirements
Optimize application performance and ensure system reliability
Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge sharing
Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends
Participate in on-call rotations to support production systems
Mentor junior engineers and contribute to team growth
curriculum: Master programming fundamentals in Python, Java, or C++ with focus on clean code
Deep dive into Data Structures (arrays, trees, graphs, heaps) and Algorithms (sorting, searching, dynamic programming)
Learn Object-Oriented Programming principles and design patterns (SOLID, Factory, Observer, Strategy)
Understand database design and work with both SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis) databases
Master version control with Git and collaborative workflows (branching, merging, pull requests)
Study software development methodologies including Agile, Scrum, and DevOps practices
Learn to use modern IDEs and development tools efficiently (VS Code, IntelliJ, debugging tools)
Understand web development fundamentals: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and popular frameworks (React, Angular)
Gain hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Master testing strategies including unit testing, integration testing, and test-driven development (TDD)
Build a portfolio of 3-5 substantial projects showcasing full-stack capabilities
Practice system design for scalable applications (load balancing, caching, microservices)
Prepare for technical interviews with LeetCode, HackerRank, and mock interview platforms
howto: Tailor your resume to highlight DSA, projects, and impact
Share GitHub/portfolio links with notable repos
Apply via the Google Careers portal
Prepare for DSA + system design interviews

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Build complete web applications from frontend to backend.
about: As a Full Stack Developer at TCS, you'll be responsible for developing complete web applications, handling both client-side and server-side development. You'll work with modern JavaScript frameworks like React for frontend and Node.js for backend, creating seamless user experiences while ensuring robust server architecture. The role involves collaborating with business analysts, designers, and other developers to translate requirements into technical solutions. You'll manage databases, implement RESTful APIs, handle authentication and authorization, and deploy applications to cloud platforms. This position offers exposure to diverse projects across multiple industries.
responsibilites: Develop responsive and interactive user interfaces using React.js and modern CSS frameworks
Build and maintain RESTful APIs using Node.js and Express.js
Design and implement database schemas using MongoDB and optimize queries
Implement user authentication and authorization using JWT and OAuth
Integrate third-party APIs and services into applications
Write unit tests and integration tests to ensure code quality
Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment
Optimize application performance for speed and scalability
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in Agile sprints
Document technical specifications and maintain code repositories
curriculum: Master HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript (ES6+) fundamentals
Learn React.js including hooks, context API, and state management with Redux
Understand Node.js runtime and build RESTful APIs with Express.js
Master MongoDB database operations, schema design, and Mongoose ODM
Learn authentication strategies: JWT tokens, sessions, and OAuth 2.0
Study frontend build tools: Webpack, Babel, and package managers (npm, yarn)
Practice version control with Git and GitHub workflows
Learn responsive design principles and CSS frameworks (Tailwind, Bootstrap)
Understand cloud deployment on platforms like AWS, Heroku, or Vercel
Master debugging techniques and browser DevTools
Build 4-6 full-stack projects: e-commerce site, social media app, task manager, blog platform
Learn basic DevOps: Docker containers, CI/CD with GitHub Actions or Jenkins
Practice coding challenges and prepare for technical interviews
howto: Review role requirements and match your projects
Ensure MERN stack portfolio links are included

title: Web Application Engineer
description: Design, develop, and test scalable web applications.
about: As a Web Application Engineer at Zoho, you'll design and develop scalable web applications using both frontend and backend technologies. This entry-level position is perfect for recent graduates who want to work on enterprise software products used by millions of businesses worldwide. You'll work with Python frameworks like Flask or Django for backend development and modern HTML/CSS/JavaScript for frontend. The role involves understanding business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, writing clean code, and collaborating with senior developers. Zoho offers a supportive learning environment where you'll gain exposure to the full software development lifecycle.
responsibilites: Develop web applications using Flask or Django frameworks
Create responsive user interfaces with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
Design and implement database schemas using MySQL or PostgreSQL
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
Participate in code reviews and learn from senior developers
Debug and fix issues reported by QA team or users
Integrate frontend components with backend APIs
Write unit tests and perform basic testing of features
Collaborate with designers to implement UI/UX designs
Contribute to technical documentation and user guides
curriculum: Learn HTML5 semantic elements, CSS3 layouts (Flexbox, Grid), and responsive design
Master JavaScript fundamentals: variables, functions, objects, DOM manipulation, and events
Study Python programming: syntax, data structures, functions, and OOP concepts
Learn Flask or Django framework basics: routing, templates, forms, and database integration
Understand relational databases: SQL queries, joins, normalization, and MySQL/PostgreSQL
Practice Git version control: commits, branches, merging, and collaboration workflows
Learn RESTful API design principles and how to consume APIs
Study web security basics: XSS, CSRF, SQL injection, and authentication
Understand MVC architecture and separation of concerns
Practice debugging with browser DevTools and Python debuggers
Build 3-4 projects: personal blog, todo app, e-commerce product catalog, user management system
Learn deployment basics: setting up servers, environment variables, and production configurations
Prepare for interviews with coding challenges and system design basics

title: Frontend Developer
skills: Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Understanding of responsive design and accessibility
about: As a Frontend Developer at Meta, you'll create exceptional user experiences for billions of users across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and other Meta products. You'll work with cutting-edge frontend technologies, primarily React and React Native, to build responsive, accessible, and performant interfaces. The role requires deep understanding of web standards, browser compatibility, and modern JavaScript. You'll collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and backend engineers to bring product visions to life. Meta values innovation, so you'll have opportunities to experiment with new technologies, contribute to open-source projects, and shape the future of social technology.
responsibilites: Develop responsive and accessible user interfaces using React.js and modern JavaScript
Implement pixel-perfect designs from Figma mockups with attention to detail
Optimize application performance: lazy loading, code splitting, and bundle optimization
Ensure cross-browser compatibility and handle edge cases gracefully
Write semantic HTML and implement WCAG accessibility standards
Collaborate with designers to refine user experiences and interactions
Implement state management using Redux, Context API, or other solutions
Write comprehensive unit and integration tests using Jest and React Testing Library
Participate in design reviews and provide technical feedback
Contribute to component libraries and design systems
Debug and resolve frontend issues using browser DevTools
Mentor junior developers and share best practices
curriculum: Master HTML5 semantic elements and accessibility best practices (ARIA roles, labels)
Deep dive into CSS3: Flexbox, Grid, animations, transitions, and modern layout techniques
Learn JavaScript deeply: closures, promises, async/await, ES6+ features, and functional programming
Study React.js comprehensively: components, hooks, lifecycle, context, and performance optimization
Master state management with Redux or Zustand including middleware and async actions
Learn TypeScript for type-safe code and better developer experience
Understand build tools: Webpack, Vite, Babel, and module bundlers
Study web performance optimization: Core Web Vitals, lighthouse scores, and profiling
Learn responsive design patterns and mobile-first development
Master CSS-in-JS solutions like styled-components or Emotion
Understand browser APIs: localStorage, fetch, Web Workers, Service Workers
Practice accessibility testing with screen readers and automated tools
Build 5-7 projects: social media feed, dashboard, e-commerce site, chat application
Learn Git advanced workflows: rebasing, cherry-picking, and collaborative development
Prepare for frontend system design interviews: component architecture, state management, performance
howto: Feature polished React work in portfolio

title: Frontend UI Engineer
about: As a Frontend UI Engineer at LinkedIn, you'll bridge the gap between design and engineering, translating beautiful Figma designs into responsive, interactive web interfaces. You'll work with React and Next.js to build professional networking features used by millions of professionals worldwide. The role requires a keen eye for design details, strong CSS skills, and the ability to create smooth animations and transitions. You'll collaborate closely with designers and product teams to ensure the final implementation matches the design vision while maintaining performance and accessibility standards. This contract position offers flexibility and exposure to LinkedIn's design system and engineering practices.
responsibilites: Convert Figma designs into pixel-perfect React components
Build reusable UI components with Tailwind CSS and custom styling
Implement smooth animations and micro-interactions using CSS and JavaScript
Ensure responsive design across all device sizes and orientations
Optimize images and assets for web performance
Collaborate with UX designers to refine interactions and user flows
Maintain and contribute to the component library and design system
Write clean, maintainable CSS following BEM or similar methodologies
Test components across different browsers and devices
Document component APIs and usage guidelines
curriculum: Master modern CSS: Grid, Flexbox, custom properties, and advanced selectors
Learn Tailwind CSS utility-first approach and configuration
Study React fundamentals and component composition patterns
Learn Next.js for server-side rendering and static site generation
Master CSS animations: keyframes, transitions, and transform properties
Study JavaScript animations with libraries like Framer Motion or GSAP
Learn Figma basics to understand design handoff and extract assets
Understand design systems and component-driven development
Practice responsive design with mobile-first approach
Learn CSS preprocessors like SASS or PostCSS
Study web fonts, typography, and visual hierarchy
Build 4-5 UI-focused projects: landing pages, dashboards, portfolios, admin panels
Learn performance optimization: critical CSS, lazy loading, and image optimization
Prepare portfolio showcasing design-to-code implementations

title: Frontend Web Designer
description: Support frontend team in UI development.
about: As a Frontend Web Designer Intern at Canva, you'll support the frontend engineering team in building beautiful, user-friendly web interfaces. This internship is designed for students or recent graduates looking to gain hands-on experience in web development. You'll work on real product features, learning from experienced engineers while contributing to Canva's design platform used by millions worldwide. The role focuses on implementing design mockups into functional web pages using HTML5, CSS3, and basic JavaScript. You'll receive mentorship, participate in code reviews, and develop both technical and professional skills in a creative, fast-paced environment.
responsibilites: Implement design mockups into semantic HTML and CSS
Create responsive layouts that work across devices
Add basic interactivity using vanilla JavaScript
Assist in testing web pages across different browsers
Fix bugs and make minor improvements to existing pages
Participate in team meetings and daily standups
Learn from code reviews and apply feedback
Document your work and share learnings with the team
Collaborate with designers to understand requirements
Contribute to the team's component library
curriculum: Learn HTML5 fundamentals: semantic elements, forms, tables, and best practices
Master CSS basics: selectors, box model, positioning, and display properties
Study CSS Grid and Flexbox for modern layouts
Learn JavaScript basics: variables, functions, DOM manipulation, and events
Understand responsive design principles and media queries
Practice CSS animations and transitions for engaging interfaces
Learn Git basics: clone, commit, push, pull, and branching
Study web accessibility fundamentals and semantic HTML
Understand browser DevTools for debugging and testing
Learn CSS naming conventions like BEM for maintainable code
Build 3-4 beginner projects: portfolio site, landing page, blog layout, product card gallery
Practice converting Figma/Sketch designs to code
Prepare for internship interviews with HTML/CSS/JS coding challenges

title: Backend Developer
about: As a Backend Developer at Netflix, you'll build and maintain the server-side systems that power one of the world's largest streaming platforms. You'll design and implement scalable APIs, manage databases, and ensure system reliability for millions of concurrent users. The role involves working with Node.js, building microservices architecture, implementing authentication and authorization systems, and optimizing performance at scale. You'll collaborate with frontend teams, data engineers, and DevOps to deliver seamless streaming experiences. Netflix values innovation and experimentation, so you'll have opportunities to work on cutting-edge distributed systems and cloud technologies.
responsibilites: Design and develop RESTful and GraphQL APIs using Node.js and Express
Build microservices architecture for scalable and maintainable systems
Implement authentication and authorization using JWT, OAuth, and session management
Design and optimize database schemas for both SQL and NoSQL databases
Implement caching strategies using Redis to improve performance
Write comprehensive unit tests, integration tests, and API documentation
Monitor application performance and optimize database queries
Implement rate limiting, error handling, and security best practices
Collaborate with frontend teams to define API contracts
Participate in on-call rotations and troubleshoot production issues
Deploy applications to AWS using Docker and Kubernetes
Contribute to technical architecture discussions and code reviews
curriculum: Master Node.js fundamentals: event loop, streams, buffers, and async patterns
Learn Express.js framework: routing, middleware, error handling, and best practices
Study database design: normalization, indexing, query optimization for PostgreSQL/MySQL
Learn MongoDB and Mongoose for NoSQL database operations
Master authentication strategies: JWT tokens, refresh tokens, OAuth 2.0, and session management
Study RESTful API design principles and best practices
Learn GraphQL: schema design, resolvers, and query optimization
Understand message queues and async processing with RabbitMQ or Bull
Master Redis for caching, session storage, and rate limiting
Learn API security: HTTPS, CORS, input validation, and SQL injection prevention
Study microservices architecture and inter-service communication
Learn Docker for containerization and Kubernetes basics
Understand AWS services: EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and API Gateway
Practice building 4-5 backend projects: REST API, authentication system, real-time chat, payment integration
Master testing with Jest, Mocha, and Supertest
Learn monitoring and logging with tools like Winston, ELK stack
Prepare for system design interviews: scalability, caching, load balancing
howto: Include API projects and database design

title: Java Backend Developer
description: Build scalable backend apps in Java.
about: As a Java Backend Developer at Infosys, you'll work on enterprise-level applications using Java and Spring Boot framework. You'll develop microservices-based architectures for clients across banking, healthcare, retail, and other industries. The role involves designing RESTful APIs, implementing business logic, integrating with databases, and ensuring application security. You'll work in Agile teams, participate in daily standups, and contribute to all phases of the software development lifecycle. Infosys provides excellent learning opportunities including certifications, training programs, and exposure to diverse technologies and domains.
responsibilites: Develop enterprise applications using Java and Spring Boot framework
Design and implement microservices architecture with API gateway patterns
Create RESTful APIs following industry best practices and standards
Implement database operations using Spring Data JPA and Hibernate ORM
Write SQL queries and optimize database performance with MySQL or PostgreSQL
Implement security features: authentication, authorization, and data encryption
Develop unit tests using JUnit and Mockito with high code coverage
Integrate third-party services and APIs into applications
Deploy applications using Docker containers and Kubernetes orchestration
Participate in code reviews and maintain code quality standards
Debug and resolve production issues with root cause analysis
Document API specifications using Swagger/OpenAPI

Learn Spring Framework: dependency injection, Spring Core, and Spring MVC
Deep dive into Spring Boot: auto-configuration, starters, and production-ready features
Study Spring Data JPA and Hibernate for database operations and ORM mapping
Learn relational database concepts: SQL, joins, indexes, transactions with MySQL
Master RESTful web services: HTTP methods, status codes, and API design
Study microservices architecture: service discovery, API gateway, circuit breaker patterns
Learn Spring Security for authentication and authorization
Understand Spring Cloud components: Config Server, Eureka, Feign, Zuul
Master build tools: Maven or Gradle for dependency management and builds
Learn Docker basics: creating images, containers, and docker-compose
Study Kubernetes fundamentals: pods, deployments, services, and ingress
Practice JUnit and Mockito for unit testing and test-driven development
Build 4-5 projects: e-commerce backend, banking system, employee management, blog API
Learn CI/CD with Jenkins or GitLab CI
Study design patterns: Singleton, Factory, Strategy, Observer

title: Python Backend Developer
about: As a Python Backend Developer at Paytm, you'll build and scale backend services for one of India's largest fintech platforms. You'll work with Flask framework to create efficient, lightweight web services handling millions of transactions daily. The role involves implementing payment processing systems, wallet services, and merchant APIs while ensuring high availability and security. You'll use Redis for caching and session management, implement queue systems for async processing, and work with databases to ensure data integrity. This position offers excellent exposure to fintech domain, payment systems, and large-scale distributed applications.
responsibilites: Develop RESTful APIs using Flask framework with clean architecture
Implement payment processing and wallet transaction services
Design and optimize database schemas for financial transactions
Implement Redis caching strategies for high-performance applications
Build asynchronous task processing using Celery and message queues
Ensure application security: encryption, secure APIs, and PCI compliance
Write comprehensive unit tests and integration tests
Optimize API response times and database query performance
Implement rate limiting and fraud detection mechanisms
Monitor application health using logging and alerting systems
Deploy applications using Gunicorn, Nginx, and Docker
Participate in code reviews and maintain high code quality
curriculum: Master Python fundamentals: data structures, OOP, decorators, generators, and context managers
Learn Flask framework: routing, blueprints, request/response handling, and extensions
Study RESTful API design and implementation best practices
Learn SQLAlchemy ORM for database operations and migrations
Master PostgreSQL or MySQL: SQL queries, transactions, indexes, and optimization
Study Redis: caching patterns, data structures, pub/sub, and session storage
Learn Celery for asynchronous task processing and background jobs
Understand message brokers: RabbitMQ or Redis as message queue
Study authentication and authorization: JWT, OAuth, API keys
Learn API security: input validation, SQL injection prevention, CORS, rate limiting

title: Data Scientist
about: As a Data Scientist at Amazon, you'll transform vast amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business decisions across e-commerce, AWS, logistics, and other divisions. You'll work with large datasets, build predictive models, conduct A/B tests, and create data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. The role requires strong statistical knowledge, proficiency in Python and SQL, and the ability to translate business problems into analytical solutions. You'll collaborate with product managers, engineers, and business leaders to identify opportunities for optimization, personalization, and growth. Amazon offers exposure to cutting-edge ML technologies and massive-scale data challenges.
responsibilites: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business insights
Build predictive models using machine learning algorithms
Design and analyze A/B tests to measure product impact
Create data visualizations and dashboards for stakeholders
Perform statistical analysis and hypothesis testing
Clean and preprocess data for analysis and modeling
Collaborate with engineering teams to productionize models
Present findings and recommendations to business leaders
Monitor model performance and retrain as needed
Write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from databases
Document methodologies and maintain reproducible analysis pipelines
Stay updated with latest ML research and techniques
curriculum: Master Python for data science: NumPy, Pandas, and data manipulation techniques
Learn statistics: probability, distributions, hypothesis testing, and confidence intervals
Study SQL deeply: joins, subqueries, window functions, and query optimization
Master data visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly for compelling charts
Learn machine learning fundamentals: supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms
Study scikit-learn: classification, regression, clustering, and model evaluation
Understand feature engineering and feature selection techniques
Learn model evaluation metrics: accuracy, precision, recall, F1, ROC-AUC
Study experiment design and A/B testing methodologies
Master Jupyter notebooks for exploratory data analysis and reporting
Learn data cleaning and preprocessing techniques for real-world messy data
Study time series analysis and forecasting methods
Understand deep learning basics with TensorFlow or PyTorch
Learn big data tools: Spark basics for handling large datasets
Build 5-6 projects: customer churn prediction, recommendation system, sales forecasting, sentiment analysis
Practice Kaggle competitions to improve modeling skills
Learn to communicate insights through storytelling with data
Prepare for data science interviews: statistics, SQL, ML algorithms, case studies
howto: Link to ML projects and notebooks

title: ML Engineer
about: As an ML Engineer at OpenAI, you'll bridge the gap between data science research and production systems, deploying machine learning models at scale. You'll build ML pipelines, optimize model performance, implement MLOps practices, and ensure models run reliably in production. The role involves working with cutting-edge AI technologies, large language models, and distributed systems. You'll collaborate with research scientists to productionize their models and with infrastructure teams to build scalable ML platforms. This senior-level position requires both strong software engineering skills and deep ML knowledge, offering opportunities to work on groundbreaking AI applications.
responsibilites: Design and implement end-to-end ML pipelines from data ingestion to model deployment
Build scalable model training infrastructure using distributed computing
Deploy ML models as REST APIs using FastAPI or Flask
Implement model monitoring, versioning, and A/B testing frameworks
Optimize model inference performance for low-latency applications
Develop data preprocessing and feature engineering pipelines
Set up CI/CD pipelines for automated model training and deployment
Implement MLOps best practices: experiment tracking, model registry, and reproducibility
Collaborate with data scientists to productionize research models
Monitor model performance and detect model drift in production
Build tools and frameworks to accelerate ML development workflows
Ensure model security, privacy, and ethical AI practices
curriculum: Master Python and software engineering best practices: design patterns, testing, code quality
Deep dive into machine learning: algorithms, model training, hyperparameter tuning
Learn TensorFlow or PyTorch for deep learning model development
Study MLOps principles and tools: MLflow, Weights & Biases, or Kubeflow
Master FastAPI or Flask for building ML model APIs
Learn Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
Study model deployment strategies: batch, real-time, edge deployment
Understand distributed computing: Spark, Dask for large-scale data processing
Learn model optimization: quantization, pruning, distillation for efficient inference

Study cloud platforms: AWS SageMaker, GCP AI Platform, or Azure ML
Learn model monitoring and observability tools
Understand data versioning with DVC or similar tools
Study model serving frameworks: TensorFlow Serving, TorchServe, ONNX Runtime

Learn feature stores and real-time feature engineering
Study system design for ML systems: scalability, reliability, latency
Prepare for ML engineering interviews: system design, ML concepts, coding

title: Data Analyst
about: As a Data Analyst at Swiggy, you'll turn raw data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions across delivery operations, customer engagement, and restaurant partnerships. You'll create dashboards, write SQL queries, analyze trends, and present findings to help optimize delivery times, improve customer satisfaction, and grow the business. This entry-level role is perfect for those starting their data career, offering hands-on experience with real business problems, exposure to large datasets, and opportunities to learn from experienced analysts. You'll work with tools like Excel, SQL, and Power BI to create impactful visualizations and reports.
responsibilites: Write SQL queries to extract and analyze data from databases
Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI or Tableau
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Calculate key business metrics and track KPIs
Conduct root cause analysis for business problems
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Present findings and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Automate recurring reports and data pipelines
Support A/B testing and experiment analysis
Document analysis methodologies and data definitions
Maintain data quality and identify data inconsistencies

Learn SQL fundamentals: SELECT, JOIN, GROUP BY, WHERE, and aggregate functions
Study advanced SQL: window functions, CTEs, subqueries, and query optimization

Learn basic statistics: mean, median, mode, standard deviation, correlation
Study data visualization principles: chart types, color theory, and storytelling
Learn Python basics for data analysis: Pandas, NumPy for data manipulation
Understand database concepts and data warehousing basics

title: UI/UX Designer
about: As a UI/UX Designer at Adobe, you'll create intuitive, beautiful user experiences for Creative Cloud products used by millions of designers, photographers, and creators worldwide. You'll conduct user research, create wireframes and prototypes, and collaborate with product managers and engineers to bring designs to life. The role requires a balance of aesthetic sensibility and user empathy, using tools like Figma and Adobe XD to craft pixel-perfect interfaces. You'll work on complex design challenges, contribute to Adobe's design system, and help shape the future of creative software. Adobe values innovation and provides a creative environment to experiment and grow your design skills.

Create user personas, journey maps, and user flows

Develop high-fidelity UI designs with attention to visual hierarchy and aesthetics

Conduct usability testing and iterate based on user feedback

title: Product Designer
about: As a Product Designer at Spotify, you'll shape the music streaming experience for over 500 million users worldwide. You'll own end-to-end product design from research to final implementation, balancing user needs with business goals. The role goes beyond UI design to include strategic thinking about product direction, conducting user research to understand listening behaviors, and collaborating closely with product managers, engineers, and data scientists. You'll work on features for music discovery, playlists, social sharing, and personalization. Spotify values data-driven design decisions and encourages experimentation, offering a creative environment where your work directly impacts how people experience music.

Conduct qualitative and quantitative user research
Create user personas, journey maps, and empathy maps
Design wireframes, mockups, and high-fidelity prototypes
Collaborate with product managers to define product strategy and roadmap
Work with data analysts to measure design impact through metrics

Create and maintain design documentation and specifications
Conduct usability testing and A/B tests to validate designs
Contribute to Spotify's design system and component library
Present design rationale and storytelling to leadership
Mentor junior designers and promote design thinking across the organization

title: Graphic Designer
about: As a Graphic Designer at Byju's, you'll create compelling visual assets for India's largest ed-tech platform, supporting marketing campaigns, product interfaces, and educational content. This entry-level contract role involves designing social media graphics, marketing collaterals, UI elements, and brand materials that engage students and parents. You'll work with Adobe Creative Suite, collaborate with marketing and product teams, and help maintain visual consistency across all touchpoints. The role offers excellent exposure to fast-paced startup environment, diverse design challenges, and opportunities to build a strong portfolio while contributing to educational transformation in India.

Create UI elements and icons for web and mobile applications
Design presentations, infographics, and educational content
Develop brand materials maintaining visual consistency with brand guidelines
Collaborate with marketing team on campaign creative concepts
Design print materials: brochures, posters, and promotional items
Edit and retouch images for various marketing channels
Create illustrations and custom graphics as needed
Prepare files for print and digital publication
Manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines
Incorporate feedback from stakeholders and iterate on designs
Organize and maintain digital asset library

Learn Adobe Illustrator: vector graphics, pen tool, typography, and logo design
Study graphic design principles: layout, composition, balance, contrast, alignment
Learn color theory: color psychology, harmony, schemes, and brand colors
Master typography: font pairing, hierarchy, readability, and type anatomy
Study branding fundamentals: logo design, brand identity, style guides
Learn print design: CMYK vs RGB, bleed, resolution, file formats
Understand digital design: web graphics, social media formats, responsive assets
Study layout design: grid systems, whitespace, visual flow
Learn basic animation principles for motion graphics (Adobe After Effects basics)
Practice creating mockups and presenting design concepts
Study current design trends while maintaining timeless principles
Learn design for different platforms: Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube
Build portfolio with 8-10 diverse projects: brand identity, social media campaign, poster series, UI elements
Practice receiving and incorporating constructive criticism
Learn basic photography and image composition
Prepare for design interviews: portfolio presentation, design challenges, tool proficiency tests
